author: Craig Nelson
title: Afghan Military Disputes Reports of Attack at Religious Ceremony
text:
KABUL—The Afghan military on Tuesday lashed out at reports that a rocket attack by government helicopters in the north had targeted a religious school where hundreds of people, including members of the Taliban, had gathered to attend a rite of passage for young students of the Quran.
Local residents and officials said Monday’s attack in the district of Dashti Archi, a Taliban stronghold on Afghanistan’s border with Tajikistan, struck a religious ceremony, killing dozens, perhaps hundreds of people including children.
